paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the BRCA2 gene along with penetrance data from the study on BRCA-associated tumors in males.

functional_data.summary: Frequent deleterious variants were identified in various tumors.

variants.additional_notes: The majority of BRCA2 mutations were somatic.
key_quotes: A total of 127 BRCA1 and 311 BRCA2 mutations were identified, of which 21.8 and 28.6% were deleterious, respectively.
Frequent deleterious variants were identified in carcinomas of the breast (100.0%), colorectum (62.2%), prostate (43.3%), and stomach (42.9%).

functional_data.summary: Frameshift mutations in BRCA2 at N1784 were frequently observed.

variants.additional_notes: This variant was frequently observed in both male and female patients.
key_quotes: Frameshift mutations in BRCA2 at N1784 (N1784Kfs*3, N1784Tfs*3) were frequently observed in both male and female patients.

patients.demographics: Male patients with both germline and somatic BRCA2 mutations

functional_data.summary: Patients displayed both germline and somatic mutations.

variants.additional_notes: These patients had a combination of mutations.
key_quotes: In addition, 13.5% (7/52) of the patients showed a microsatellite instability-high (MSI-H) phenotype, while 30.7% showed moderate to high TMB (≥10 mutations/Mb).

tables_processed.table_caption: Characteristics of male BRCAm carriers with a diagnosis of tumor in SYSUCC cohort
Characteristics of BRCAm carriers with a diagnosis of tumor in TCGA cohort

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
